Package com.markgrand.smileyvars.spring

Class SmileyVarsJdbcTemplate

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.springframework.jdbc.support.JdbcAccessor
      • org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate
        • com.markgrand.smileyvars.spring.SmileyVarsJdbcTemplate
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.springframework.beans.factory.InitializingBean, org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcOperations
    public class SmileyVarsJdbcTemplate
extends org.springframework.jdbc.core.JdbcTemplate
    This is an extension of JdbcTemplate that supports SmileyVars Templates.
    Author:
    Mark Grand
    See Also:
    SmileyVarsTemplate,

      • SmileyVarsJdbcTemplate

        public SmileyVarsJdbcTemplate​(@NotNull
                              @NotNull DataSource dataSource,
                              boolean lazyInit)
        Construct a new JdbcTemplate, given a DataSource to obtain connections from.

        Note: Depending on the "lazyInit" flag, initialization of the exception translator will be triggered.

        Parameters:
        dataSource - the JDBC DataSource to obtain connections from
        lazyInit - whether to lazily initialize the SQLExceptionTranslator

      • executeSmileyVars

        public <T> T executeSmileyVars​(@NotNull
                               @NotNull String sql,
                               @NotNull
                               @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlFunction<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement,​T> svpsFunction)
        Create a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement from the given SQL and pass it to the given function. Here is a usage example: 
         int quantity
    = svjt.withSmileyVars("SELECT quantity FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level AND bin_number = :bin_number",
         svps -< {
             try (ResultSet rs = svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1). setInt("bin_number", 7).executeQuery()) {
                 return rs.getInt("quantity");
             }
         }));
        Type Parameters:
        T - The of value to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sql - The sql to be used as a SmileyVars template.
        svpsFunction - A function that takes the SmileyVarsPreparedStatement created from the SQL and returns the desired result.
        Returns:
        the value that is returned by the given function.

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> T querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                             @NotNull String sql,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.ResultSetExtractor<T> rse)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. A return value is produced by executing the sql and passing the result set to the given ResultSetExtractor object. Here is a usage example: 
             String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
     List>Inventory< inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, svps-> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1), rse);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object that the method is expected to produce
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        rse - a callback that will extract results
        Returns:
        the result object returned by the ResultSetExtractor
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> T querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                             @NotNull String sql,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull String[] names,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull Object[] values,
                             @NotNull
                             @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.ResultSetExtractor<T> rse)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given name and value arrays. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Take the ResultSet that is produced and use the given ResultSetExtractor to produce the value that will be returned by this method. Here is a usage example: 
             String[] names = {"aisle", "level"};
     Integer[] values = {4, 1};
     String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
     List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, names, values, rse);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        names - The names of the variables whose values are being specified.
        values - The corresponding values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rse - The ResultSetExtractor to use for extracting a result from the query's result set.
        Returns:
        the value produced by the ResultSetExtractor.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the names and values arrays are not the same length

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> T querySmileyVars​(String sql,
                             Map<String,​?> valueMap,
                             org.springframework.jdbc.core.ResultSetExtractor<T> rse)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given map. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Take the ResultSet that is produced and use the given ResultSetExtractor to produce the value that will be returned by this method. Here is a usage example: 
            Map<String, Object> valueMap = new HashMap<>();
    valueMap.put("aisle", 4);
    valueMap.put("level", 1);
    String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
    List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, valueMap, rse);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of value to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        valueMap - The values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rse - The ResultSetExtractor to use for extracting a result from the query's result set.
        Returns:
        the value produced by the ResultSetExtractor.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.

      • querySmileyVars

        public void querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                            @NotNull String sql,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowCallbackHandler rch)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. The SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is executed. Each row of the ResultSet that is produced is passed it to the given RowCallbackHandler. Here is a usage example: 
             String sql = "SELECT item_number, quantity FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
     svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, svps-> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1), rs->{
         processItemCount(rs.getString("item_number"), rs.getInt("quantity"));
     });
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        rch - a callback that is called to process each row.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • querySmileyVars

        public void querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                            @NotNull String sql,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull String[] names,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull Object[] values,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowCallbackHandler rch)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given name and value arrays. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Take the ResultSet that is produced and process each row by passing it to the given RowCallbackHandler. Here is a usage example: 
            String[] names = {"aisle", "level"};
    Integer[] values = {4, 1};
    int[] count = {0};
    String sql = "SELECT item_number, quantity FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
    svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, names, values, rs-$gt; {
        processItemCount(rs.getString("item_number"), rs.getInt("quantity"));
    });
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        names - The names of the variables whose values are being specified.
        values - The corresponding values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rch - The RowCallbackHandler to use for processing each row from the query's result set.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the names and values arrays are not the same length

      • querySmileyVars

        public void querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                            @NotNull String sql,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull Map<String,​?> valueMap,
                            @NotNull
                            @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowCallbackHandler rch)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given map. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Take the ResultSet that is produced and process each row by passing it to the given RowCallbackHandler. Here is a usage example: 
            Map<String, Object> valueMap = new HashMap<>();
    valueMap.put("aisle", 4);
    valueMap.put("level", 1);
    int[] count = {0};
    String sql = "SELECT item_number, quantity FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
    svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, valueMap, rs->{
        processItemCount(rs.getString("item_number"), rs.getInt("quantity"));
    });
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        valueMap - The values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rch - The RowCallbackHandler to use for processing each row from the query's result set.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> List<T> querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull String sql,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> rowMapper)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. The SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is executed. Each row of the ResultSet that is produced is passed it to the given RowMapper. A list of the results returned by each RowMapper call is returned. Here is a usage example: 
            List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars("SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)",
         svps -> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1),
         rowMapper);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to return in the list.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        rowMapper - a callback that is called to process each row into a value.
        Returns:
        a list of the values returned by the calls to the RowMapper.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> List<T> querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull String sql,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull String[] names,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull Object[] values,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> rowMapper)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given name and value arrays. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Each row of the ResultSet that is produced is passed it to the given RowMapper. A list of the results returned by each RowMapper call is returned. Here is a usage example: 
            String[] names = {"aisle", "level"};
    Integer[] values = {4, 1};
    String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
    List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, names, values, rowMapper);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to return in the list.
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        names - The names of the variables whose values are being specified.
        values - The corresponding values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rowMapper - a callback that is called to process each row into a value.
        Returns:
        the result List, containing mapped objects
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the names and values arrays are not the same length

      • querySmileyVars

        public <T> List<T> querySmileyVars​(@NotNull
                                   @NotNull String sql,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull Map<String,​Object> valueMap,
                                   @NotNull
                                   @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> rowMapper)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given name and value arrays. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. Each row of the ResultSet that is produced is passed it to the given RowMapper. A list of the results returned by each RowMapper call is returned. Here is a usage example: 
         final String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
 List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, svps -> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1), rowMapper);
        Map<String, Object> valueMap = new HashMap<>(); valueMap.put("aisle", 4); valueMap.put("level", 1); String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)"; List<Inventory> inventoryList = svjt.querySmileyVars(sql, valueMap, rowMapper);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be returned in the list.
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        valueMap - The values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rowMapper - a callback that is called to process each row into a value.
        Returns:
        the result object of the required type, or null in case of SQL NULL
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.

      • queryForObjectSmileyVars

        public <T> T queryForObjectSmileyVars​(@NotNull
                                      @NotNull String sql,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> rowMapper)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. A return value is produced by executing the prepared statement and passing the result set containing a single row to the given RowMapper object. Here is a usage example: 
             String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
     Inventory inventory = svjt.queryForObjectSmileyVars(sql, svps-> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1).setInt("bin_number", 8), rowMapper);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        rowMapper - a callback that is called to process the single row into a value.
        Returns:
        the result object returned by the ResultSetExtractor
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • queryForObjectSmileyVars

        public <T> T queryForObjectSmileyVars​(String sql,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull String[] names,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull Object[] values,
                                      @NotNull
                                      @NotNull org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> rowMapper)
        Expand the given SQL as a SmileyVars template using the variable values specified in the given name and value arrays. Execute the expanded SQL as a Statement. A return value is produced by passing result set containing a single row to the given RowMapper object. Here is a usage example: 
            String[] names = {"aisle", "level", "bin_number"};
    Object[] values = {4, 1, 8};
    String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
    Inventory inventory = svjt.queryForObjectSmileyVars(sql, names, values, rowMapper);
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of object to be returned.
        Parameters:
        sql - The string to use as the SmileyVars template body.
        names - The names of the variables whose values are being specified.
        values - The corresponding values to use for the variables in the template body.
        rowMapper - a callback that is called to process each row into a value.
        Returns:
        the result object of the required type, or null in case of SQL NULL
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is a problem.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the names and values arrays are not the same length

                                                      @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. A return value is produced by executing the prepared statement to produce result set containing a single row and converting the row to a Map. Here is a usage example: 
            Map<String, Object> resultMap = svjt.queryForMapSmileyVars("SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)",
         svps -> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1).setInt("bin_number", 8));

        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        Returns:
        A map whose keys are the value in the result row and whose values are the values from the result row.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

         String.class);

        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        elementType - the required type of element in the result list (for example, Integer.class)
        Returns:
        A List whose elements are the single value in each result row.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • queryForListSmileyVars

        public List<Map<String,​Object>> queryForListSmileyVars​(String sql,
                                                             @NotNull
                                                             @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.util.SqlConsumer<com.markgrand.smileyvars.SmileyVarsPreparedStatement> setter)
        Query using a SmileyVarsPreparedStatement. A SmileyVarsPreparedStatement is created from the given sql. The prepared statement is executed to produce a result set. A Map is created for each row. The keys of these maps are the column names and the value are the values from the row. A list of these Map objects is returned. Here is a usage example: 
             String sql = "SELECT * FROM inventory WHERE aisle = :aisle AND level = :level (: AND bin_number = :bin_number :)";
     List<Map<String, Object>> inventoryMapList = svjt.queryForListSmileyVars(sql,
         svps -> svps.setInt("aisle", 4).setInt("level", 1));
        Parameters:
        sql - The SQL to use for the SmileyVars template.
        setter - a consumer function that sets the values of variables in the SmileVars template.
        Returns:
        A List that contains a Map for each returned row.
        Throws:
        org.springframework.dao.DataAccessException - if there is any problem

      • batchUpdate

        @NotNull
public @org.jetbrains.annotations.NotNull int[] batchUpdate​(@NotNull
                                                            @NotNull String sql,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            @NotNull com.markgrand.smileyvars.MapSetter mapSetter,
                                                            @NotNull
                                                            @NotNull Collection<Map<String,​Object>> valueMaps)
        Execute a batch of updates/inserts using the given SQL as a SmileyVars template.
        Parameters:
        sql - The sql to use as the body of a SmileyVars template.
        mapSetter - A MapSetter that specifies the methods to use for setting the parameter values in the SmileyVars template.
        valueMaps - A collection of Maps that specify sets of values to be used for the batch.
        Returns:
        an array of the number of rows affected by each update. The order of the elements in the array will be arbitrary.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object. In general, the toString method returns a string that "textually represents" this object. The result should be a concise but informative representation that is easy for a person to read. It is recommended that all subclasses override this method.

        The toString method for class Object returns a string consisting of the name of the class of which the object is an instance, the at-sign character `@', and the unsigned hexadecimal representation of the hash code of the object. In other words, this method returns a string equal to the value of: 

         getClass().getName() + '@' + Integer.toHexString(hashCode())
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the object.
